metadata.methodology: Manual digitization from published geological references
metadata.accuracy: Formation boundaries ±1-5km based on geological mapping resolution

properties.name: Smackover Formation
properties.description: Subsurface Jurassic carbonate aquifer with high-concentration lithium brines. One of the richest lithium deposits in North America discovered in 2023.
properties.counties: Harrison, Panola, Rusk, Gregg, Marion, Cass, Upshur, Smith, Cherokee
properties.development: Active development by Exxon (Project Evergreen), Chevron, Halliburton, Smackover Lithium, TerraVolta (DOE $225M funding), EnergyX (targeting 50,000 tons/year by 2030). Direct lithium extraction from brines using selective sorbent technology. Pilot facilities operational in Harrison and Panola counties.
properties.reserves_estimate: Estimated 3-6 million tons lithium metal equivalent. Brine concentrations 200-400 mg/L Li.
properties.source: Texas Bureau of Economic Geology Report 2023-01; Exxon SEC Filings 2024

properties.name: Round Top Mountain
properties.minerals: Heavy REEs (Dy, Tb, Y, Er, Eu), Light REEs (La, Ce, Nd), plus Li, Be, U, Th, Ga, Nb, Ta
properties.description: Late Eocene rhyolite laccolith containing one of the world's highest-grade heavy REE deposits. NI 43-101 measured+indicated resources of 315,000 MT total rare earth oxides (TREO). Unique enrichment in critical heavy REEs (dysprosium, terbium) used in permanent magnets.
properties.development: Advanced stage development by USA Rare Earth LLC (acquired from TMRC 2021). Definitive Feasibility Study completed 2023. DoD Defense Production Act Title III award for domestic heavy REE production. Targeting startup 2025-2026 with 2,000 tons/year magnet production. On-site acid leaching + solvent extraction processing.
properties.deposit_type: Peralkaline rhyolite laccolith with ion-adsorption style mineralization
properties.reserves_estimate: 315,000 MT TREO (measured+indicated). Heavy REE enrichment: Dy 4.2%, Tb 0.6%.
properties.source: TMRC NI 43-101 Technical Report 2019; USA Rare Earth DFS 2023

properties.name: Llano Uplift (Central Mineral Region)
properties.minerals: REEs (in pegmatites), Uranium, Thorium, Beryllium, Lithium, plus industrial minerals (granite, sandstone)
properties.description: Precambrian basement rocks exposed at surface in Texas Hill Country. Contains Mesoproterozoic granite-rhyolite complexes (Town Mountain Granite, Enchanted Rock batholith) with pegmatite dikes hosting REE mineralization. Historic uranium mining 1950s-1980s. Current focus on REE potential in pegmatites and rare-metal granites.
properties.counties: Llano, Burnet, San Saba, Mason, Gillespie, Blanco
properties.development: Research and assessment phase. USGS Earth MRI critical minerals focus area. University of Texas at Austin Bureau of Economic Geology conducting regional geochemical surveys. No active commercial production. Historic mining: iron ore (1890s-1940s), uranium (1950s-1970s), granite quarries (ongoing).
properties.deposit_type: Granitic pegmatites and rare-metal granites in domal basement uplift
properties.reserves_estimate: Undetermined; exploratory assessment ongoing. Historic U production ~200 tons U3O8.
properties.source: USGS PP 1370-A (1986); BEG Geologic Atlas Llano Sheet (2007)

properties.name: Sierra Blanca / Eagle Mountains District
properties.description: Tertiary volcanic field with beryllium mineralization in rhyolite domes and pegmatites. Genetically related to Round Top Mountain laccolith. Historic fluorite mining (1940s-1960s). Beryllium occurs as bertrandite in tuff and as phenakite in pegmatites.
properties.development: No current commercial production. Resources identified through USGS mapping and academic research (UT El Paso). Beryllium potential noted but undeveloped. Environmental sensitivities (proximity to wilderness areas) limit exploration. Exploratory sampling by junior miners 2015-2020 (inactive).
properties.reserves_estimate: Historic fluorite production ~10,000 tons. Be resources identified but not quantified.

properties.name: Brewster County Ranch
properties.minerals: Rare Earth Elements (specific types not publicly disclosed)
properties.description: 353,785-acre ranch (1,432 km²) in Trans-Pecos volcanic region purchased by Texas General Land Office in 2024 following geological survey that identified REE mineralization. Specific deposit details remain confidential during assessment phase. Located in Tertiary volcanic rocks of Big Bend region.
properties.development: Exploratory stage. Land acquired by Texas GLO August 2024 for $31.3 million. No drilling permits or development plans announced publicly. Geological assessment likely ongoing by Texas Bureau of Economic Geology. Represents strategic state investment in critical minerals independence. Public reporting expected 2025-2026.
properties.deposit_type: Unknown; likely volcanic-hosted REE (alkaline volcanics or peralkaline rhyolites)
properties.reserves_estimate: Unknown; early reconnaissance stage. Deposit characteristics confidential.
properties.source: Texas GLO press releases (Aug 2024); Texas Tribune reporting

properties.name: Dell City Area
properties.description: USGS Earth Mapping Resources Initiative (Earth MRI) focus area for critical minerals. Exploratory geochemical sampling of Tertiary igneous rocks indicates potential REE mineralization similar to Round Top Mountain system. Part of larger Trans-Pecos alkaline igneous province.
properties.development: Research and assessment phase. USGS Earth MRI Phase 2 funding ($3.4 million allocated 2023-2024) for geochemical surveys and airborne geophysics. Academic collaboration with UT Austin, UT El Paso, and New Mexico Bureau of Geology. No drilling or extraction permits. Focus area for federal critical minerals mapping under Energy Act of 2020.
properties.deposit_type: Potential alkaline igneous-hosted REEs (laccolith or ring complex)
properties.reserves_estimate: Unknown; assessment stage. Geochemical anomalies identified.
properties.source: USGS Earth MRI Project documentation (2023); New Mexico BG OFR 622 (2022)

properties.name: Panhandle Helium District
properties.description: One of the world's largest helium-producing regions. Helium occurs as non-combustible gas (0.3-1.9% He) in Permian natural gas reservoirs (Granite Wash, Red Cave formations). Critical for semiconductor manufacturing, MRI medical imaging, aerospace, fiber optics, and scientific research. Texas produces ~1/3 of global helium supply.
properties.counties: Potter, Moore, Hutchinson, Carson, Gray, Hansford, Ochiltree, Lipscomb, Hemphill, Sherman, Dallam
properties.development: Active large-scale production. Five major helium extraction plants operational: Cliffside (closed 2021, BLM federal reserve), private operators include Air Products, Linde, Messer, Keyes Helium, and independent producers. New Javelina plant (Hansford County) started 2024, 25 MMcf/day capacity. Strategic resource for U.S. technology and defense sectors. Federal Helium Reserve (Amarillo) storing 6 billion cubic feet.
properties.deposit_type: Natural gas-associated helium (crustal radiogenic origin, trapped in anticlines)
properties.reserves_estimate: Multiple decades of production at current rates (~2 billion cubic feet/year Texas share)
properties.source: USGS Circular 1354 (2010); Texas RRC Helium Production Data (2024)

properties.name: Cave Peak / Trans-Pecos Volcanic Field
properties.description: Tertiary porphyry-style molybdenum deposit with associated rare earth elements in Trans-Pecos volcanic complex. Part of larger Big Bend magmatic province. Molybdenum mineralization in quartz-molybdenite stockwork veins cutting rhyolite porphyry. REEs in accessory minerals (allanite, monazite).
properties.development: Research stage only. Academic studies by UT Austin Jackson School of Geosciences and USGS. No mining permits or commercial interest. Geological significance as indicator of regional porphyry-style mineralization. Located within Big Bend Ranch State Park (development restrictions). Baseline geochemical characterization completed 2010s.
properties.deposit_type: Porphyry molybdenum (Climax-type) with disseminated REE enrichment
properties.reserves_estimate: Undetermined; reconnaissance stage. Surface sampling shows Mo anomalies >100 ppm.
properties.source: Texas A&M Geochemical Atlas; USGS Big Bend volcanic studies
